Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic text on recto (9 ll., lower part of an originally longer document), blank on verso. Contract lease. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Probably part of an oath with penalty of 500 talents for non-performance. Date. year 27 Payni 18 of unnamed King - tho script is late Ptolemaic - if so, it must be either Euergetes II (144/3) (or 27 Alex. I is year of his death BC. 88) or Auletes (55/4), most likely the latter from the script".
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (312) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/312)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: loss, fractured Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: kraft paper Binding: self adhesive linen tape Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: incomplete - upper part lost
